content.introduction:
google-readability-function-size
 redirects here as an alias for this check.

Checks for large functions based on various metrics.

Options
Â¶






LineThreshold
Â¶


Flag functions exceeding this number of lines. The default is 
none
 (ignore
the number of lines).








StatementThreshold
Â¶


Flag functions exceeding this number of statements. This may differ
significantly from the number of lines for macro-heavy code. The default is

800
.








BranchThreshold
Â¶


Flag functions exceeding this number of control statements. The default is

none
 (ignore the number of branches).








ParameterThreshold
Â¶


Flag functions that exceed a specified number of parameters. The default
is 
none
 (ignore the number of parameters).








NestingThreshold
Â¶


Flag compound statements which create next nesting level after

NestingThreshold
. This may differ significantly from the expected value
for macro-heavy code. The default is 
none
 (ignore the nesting level).








VariableThreshold
Â¶


Flag functions exceeding this number of variables declared in the body.
The default is 
none
 (ignore the number of variables).
Please note that function parameters and variables declared in lambdas,
GNU Statement Expressions, and nested class inline functions are not counted.








CountMemberInitAsStmt
Â¶


When 
true
, count class member initializers in constructors as statements.
Default is 
true
.
